jobs.title: VP of People
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Our mission at Ello is simple and urgent: Maximize the potential of every child, everywhere.

We’re building the world’s first AI teacher to close that gap: one that listens, speaks, adapts, and inspires, just like the best human educators.

Our first product, Read with Ello, is already helping tens of thousands of kids each week learn to read. It listens as they read aloud, offers support when they stumble, and generates magical, personalized stories using generative AI. It works—and kids love it.

Now, we’re scaling that success into something even bigger: a complete AI teacher for all children. We’re building a real-time learning platform that combines language, speech, and memory to power personalized, interactive education for kids worldwide. We’re moving fast: we ship weekly, test directly with kids and families, and push the boundaries of what AI can do in education.

With the resources of the world's top investors and the heart of a public benefit corporation, we’re here to revolutionize how children learn globally. Featured on TIME’s Best Inventions and Fortune’s Change the World, Ello is a small, mission-driven team taking on one of the most critical challenges of our time: to democratize education.

About the role

We’re seeking an experienced and strategic VP of People to join our San Francisco-based leadership team and scale the people operations foundation to grow Ello from 45 to 200+ employees. You’ll be our first executive People leader—not just scaling the function, but owning it. This is a unique opportunity to shape the systems, processes, and culture that will guide us through Ello’s next chapter of growth. You’ll bring the judgment, gravitas, and experience to be a true peer to our three co-founders, earning trust through clarity, care, and a track record of scaling organizations with both rigor and heart.

As our VP of People, you’ll shape the entire employee experience – owning the full People stack from compensation and performance to recruiting, immigration, and culture. You'll partner closely with our three co-founders as both a strategic advisor and trusted coach, building scalable systems while maintaining the care and relationships that make Ello special.

This is a role for a seasoned People leader who has helped a company go from scrappy startup (< 30 people) to thriving organization (150+) while preserving the heart of its culture. You bring a clear strategic vision paired with the IC drive to roll up your sleeves and execute.

Our mission to maximize every child's potential begins with our people, so we’re looking for a leader who shares our commitment to unlocking the full potential of every teammate. If you’re a strong, values-driven leader who loves designing systems and processes that help people thrive, we’d love to meet you.

Responsibilities

  • Serve as a strategic partner to Ello’s co-founders and leadership team, shaping org design, team structure, and people strategy as we scale

  • Lead with values: evolve Ello’s culture as we grow, maintaining and building it through each inflection point

  • Build and scale People systems—across performance, compensation, and recruiting

    • Build out comprehensive compensation frameworks and benefits programs that attract and retain top talent

    • Design and run performance management systems that drive growth and accountability across the organization

    • Ensure every new hire has a world-class recruiting and onboarding experience

    • Build people analytics to inform smarter, faster decisions

    • Ensure our physical spaces, travel experiences, and day-to-day operations make every team member feel cared for and supported

  • Be a trusted coach and advisor to executives and managers across the company, helping them to grow as leaders and decision makers

  • Define how AI and People intersect, ensuring the function and our people are prepared for this paradigm shift.

About you

  • 8+ years of People/HR leadership with proven startup scaling experience

  • Deep expertise in compensation, equity, benefits, performance, and recruiting at growth-stage companies

  • Strategic thinker with strong execution skills and a process-oriented mindset

  • Experienced coach and mentor who develops managers and leaders at all levels

  • Excellent communicator: clear, direct, empathetic, and skilled at both giving and receiving feedback

  • Values-driven and relationship-centered: you care deeply about building a culture where people feel supported and seen

  • Thrive in ambiguity, bringing clarity and structure to complex situations

  • Excellent judgment and can build trust quickly through integrity and strong interpersonal skills

Bonus points

  • Have experience with global offices and immigration processes

  • Have guided a company through complex transitions, including fundraising stages, leadership transitions, and org redesigns.

We look for candidates who

  • Have something to teach us

  • Take initiative and full ownership of their work

  • Want to do work they are proud of to build a company they are proud of

  • Have an urge to make a real impact on child development at scale

  • Prefer open and direct communication grounded in empathy to beating around the bush

  • Exemplify integrity in their actions, decisions, and communication

  • Want to build meaningful relationships at work

  • Bring good judgment to complex, high-stakes decisions and are comfortable challenging senior leaders when necessary

  • Understand how to scale culture, not just preserve it

Here are some reasons to be a part of our team

  • Help build the future of education with mission-driven teammates who care deeply about each other and the work we’re doing

  • Shape and scale the People function at a fast-growing, well-funded, award-wining startup

  • Join the senior leadership team and influence company direction and culture

About Ello

Ello is a public benefit corporation on a mission to maximize the potential of all children. We’re currently around 45 people, headquartered in San Francisco, with offices in São Paulo, Brazil; Nairobi, Kenya; and New York.

Our team has deep expertise in artificial intelligence, K-12 education, and child development across institutions such as Stanford, Berkeley, Google, Apple, and more. We were part of Y Combinator’s W20 batch and are funded by world-class investors, including Goodwater Capital, Homebrew, Reed Hastings, Common Sense Growth, Ravensburger, Project A Ventures, Reach Capital, Khosla Ventures, WndrCo, Visible Ventures, and K9 Ventures.

We’re a small, collaborative team that takes each other’s voices seriously. Because our mission is to support all children, our team must be representative of the communities we work in; we place significant emphasis on ensuring diversity in our team and inclusion in our culture.

We feel enormously privileged to be one of the few companies with the opportunity to take a shot at truly revolutionizing education with AI at this inflection point in technology. We don’t take it for granted, so we work urgently to turn that vision into reality. We want to create an environment where we can all be our best selves, use our strengths to take Ello forward, and develop our skills. We want to have fun while working hard to do impactful things we’re proud of – and we believe it’s possible to do both.

At Ello, diversity is a moral imperative and a competitive advantage. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, skin color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We plan and structure our interviews to assess skills and experience directly. If you need accommodations throughout the interview process, please contact recruiting@ello.com.

jobs.title: Product Engineer, Growth
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Our mission at Ello is simple and urgent: Maximize the potential of every child, everywhere.

We’re building the world’s first AI teacher to close that gap: one that listens, speaks, adapts, and inspires, just like the best human educators.

We’re moving fast: we ship weekly, test directly with kids and families, and push the boundaries of what AI can do in education.

With the resources of the world's top investors and the heart of a public benefit corporation, we’re here to revolutionize how children learn globally. Featured on TIME’s Best Inventions and Fortune’s Change the World, Ello is a small, mission-driven team taking on one of the most important challenges of our time: to democratize education.

About the role

We’re looking for a strong Growth Engineer to independently own end-to-end features to improve user acquisition, engagement, and retention for Ello. You will bridge the gap between engineering, product, and marketing to test and implement data-driven growth strategies. You’ll be part of a small and nimble team responsible for the full growth stack, from designing user-facing flows & prototype experiences to developing backend pipelines, experimentation frameworks, and analytics tooling. You are an engineer with a business mindset who enjoys finding leverage through code, loves rapidly iterating based on data, and thrives optimizing funnels and scaling user impact. You are comfortable working full-stack and across multiple programming environments. You have experience building growth features like A/B testing systems, referral programs, onboarding flows, and notifications. You’re highly curious and metrics-driven, with a strong bias toward experimentation and execution.

We welcome candidates from all backgrounds – frontend, backend, growth product – but we prioritize strong technical foundations and proven impact on user or revenue growth. You’ve launched and scaled successful growth initiatives, either at a high-growth startup or as part of a dedicated growth team at a larger company. We work in-person out of our San Francisco office (minimum 3 days/week), and we’re big believers in face-to-face collaboration.

Responsibilities

  • Build and own growth features end-to-end, from ideation to deployment

  • Develop A/B testing and experimentation frameworks to validate growth hypotheses

  • Collaborate with product, marketing, and data to identify high-leverage growth opportunities

  • Improve conversion, retention, and engagement across the user lifecycle

  • Build and iterate on onboarding, referral, and notification systems

  • Analyze user data to generate actionable insights and inform strategy

Required Experience

  • Engineering:

    • Strong experience with growth-focused features (e.g. onboarding flows, developing in-app features, emails/notifications, referral loops)

    • Experience with at least one of: Flutter, React (or equivalent web framework), native Android development in Java/Kotlin, or iOS development in Swift/ObjC

    • Leveraged GenAI tools to accelerate your work impact

    • Familiarity with GenAI models & pipelines, including human eval infrastructure

    • Experience with A/B testing infrastructure and analytics tools (e.g. Amplitude,
      Mixpanel, Segment, Google Analytics)

    • Familiarity with data pipelines, ETL, and writing custom metrics queries

    • Proficient with modern frontend frameworks (React, Flutter) and backend systems (Python, Node.js, Go, or equivalent)

    • Ability to set up and interpret product metrics, dashboards, and cohort analyses

  • Growth & Product:

    • Demonstrated experience owning and scaling impactful growth experiments

    • Strong product sense and intuition for user experience and conversion optimization

    • Experience working with marketing teams and customer acquisition funnels

    • Cross-functional mindset: comfortable collaborating across product, design,
      marketing, and engineering

    • Familiarity with agile development methodologies and collaborative development tools

Nice to have experience

  • Experience with building products or features designed for children and parents

  • Familiar with the range of tools & services available to build a full end-to-end customer solutions

  • Developed solutions that integrated across third-party systems (e.g. Stripe, Twilio, SendGrid, CRMs, etc.)

  • Deep understanding of front-end architectures (web & mobile), design patterns, and performance optimization techniques

We look for candidates who

  • Have a desire to build & innovate

  • Have something to teach us

  • Want to do work they are proud of, and ship products they are proud of

  • Have an urge to make a real impact on child development at scale

  • Take initiative and full ownership of their work

  • Prefer open and direct communication grounded in empathy to beating around the bush

  • Exemplify integrity in their actions, decisions, and communication

  • Want to build meaningful relationships at work

Here are some reasons to be a part of our team

  • Dive deep into the rapidly evolving world of AI and interactive learning.

  • Experience the joy of turning your designs and code into engaging and educational experiences for children worldwide

  • Be part of an A+ team and an engineering culture of excellence

About Ello

Ello is a public benefit corporation on a mission to maximize the potential of all children. We’re currently around 45 people, headquartered in San Francisco, with offices in São Paulo, Brazil; Nairobi, Kenya; and New York.

Our team has deep expertise in artificial intelligence, K-12 education, and child development across institutions such as Stanford, Berkeley, Google, Apple, and more. We were part of Y Combinator’s W20 batch and are funded by world-class investors including Goodwater Capital, Homebrew, Reed Hastings, Common Sense Growth, Ravensburger, Project A Ventures, Reach Capital, Khosla Ventures, WndrCo, Visible Ventures, and K9 Ventures.

We’re a small, collaborative team that takes each other’s voices very seriously. Because our mission is to support all children, it is crucial that our team reflects the communities in which we work; we place significant emphasis on ensuring diversity within our team and fostering inclusion in our culture.

We feel enormously privileged to be one of the few companies that has the opportunity to take a shot at truly revolutionizing education with AI at this inflection point in technology. We don’t take it for granted, so we work quite hard to turn that vision into reality with urgency. We want to create an environment in which we can all be our best selves, use our strengths to take Ello forward, and develop our skills. We want to have fun while working hard to do impactful things that we’re proud of – and we believe it’s possible to do both.

At Ello, diversity is a moral imperative and a competitive advantage. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, skin color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We plan and structure our interviews to assess skills and experience directly. If you need accommodations throughout the interview process, please contact recruiting@ello.com.

jobs.title: Machine Learning Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Our mission at Ello is simple and urgent: Maximize the potential of every child, everywhere. To close that gap, we’re building the world’s first AI tutor: one that listens, speaks, adapts, and inspires, just like the best human teachers.

Our first product, Read with Ello, is already helping tens of thousands of kids each week learn to read. It listens as they read aloud, offers support when they stumble, and generates magical, personalized stories.

Now, we’re scaling that success into something even bigger: a complete AI teacher for all children. It’s a 1:1 tutor that combines language, speech, and memory to deliver interactive education for kids worldwide. We move fast and test directly with families to create products that kids love.

About the role

We’re looking for an ML Engineer to join our 5-person applied ML team. Our team operates at the intersection of research and production, solving open-ended problems while delivering real-world products. We use the best tool for the job, whether that’s a novel machine learning model or software engineering fundamentals.

You’re excited to build an AI product that pushes the boundaries of what’s possible in education. You believe that great products and research strengthen each other. You’ll thrive here if you enjoy building scalable systems from the ground up and bringing research to life in real-world products. You’ll make an edit in your Jupyter notebook this week, deploy it on-device next week, and watch it bring smiles to kids’ faces a day later.

What You’ll Do

  • Own projects end-to-end from data through to production (e.g. conversational agents, learner adaptation, or speech perception)

  • Collaborate with learning experts and product engineers to translate research into an AI tutor that understands, adapts, and interacts with children everywhere

  • Build with the latest advancements in machine learning

About you

  • 3+ years of experience in AI/ML research or engineering, preferably with speech systems or LLMs

  • Proven track record across the modeling lifecycle: data acquisition, experimentation, evaluation, and productionization

  • Experience with Python, deep learning frameworks, and distributed computing

  • Proficiency in applied mathematics and linear algebra at the level where you can contribute to research discussions with a deeply technical team

Bonus points

  • Public projects that demonstrate technical creativity

  • Track record of publications in top machine learning conferences (NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, etc.)

  • Depth in low-latency inference at scale

  • Strong product intuition

We look for candidates who

  • Have something to teach us

  • Have an urge to make a real impact on child development at scale

  • Take initiative and full ownership of their work

  • Prefer open and direct communication grounded in empathy to beating around the bush

  • Want to build meaningful relationships at work

Who you’ll be joining

Ello’s 5-person applied ML team includes some of the world’s foremost experts in their areas. For instance, our speech perception efforts are led by the co-authors of wav2vec. At Ello, they’ve built the world’s best child speech recognition system, beating Whisper. That ability to deeply understand child speech enables us to design magical experiences for early childhood learning. We work on a broad range of machine learning problems across agent reliability, learner adaptation, and multimodal perception. We collaborate closely with advisors from Stanford and top industry research labs (on a weekly basis, not in some hands-off way). We work in-person out of our San Francisco office and we’re big believers in face-to-face collaboration.

A note on immigration

We don’t shy away from sponsoring US visas and green card petitions. Our CTO and CEO have each gone through their own immigration journeys and are familiar with the challenges. We have successfully secured O-1 visas, H-1B transfers, etc. for Ello employees and retain top immigration counsel.

About Ello

Ello is a public benefit corporation on a mission to maximize the potential of all children. We’re currently around 45 people, headquartered in San Francisco, with offices in São Paulo, Brazil; Nairobi, Kenya; and New York.

Our team has deep expertise in artificial intelligence, K-12 education, and child development across institutions such as Stanford, Berkeley, Google, Apple, and more. We were part of Y Combinator’s W20 batch and are funded by world-class investors including Goodwater Capital, Homebrew, Reed Hastings, Common Sense Growth, Ravensburger, Project A Ventures, Reach Capital, Khosla Ventures, WndrCo, Visible Ventures, and K9 Ventures.

We’re a small, collaborative team that takes each other’s voices very seriously. Because our mission is to support all children, it is critical that our team is representative of the communities we work in; we place significant emphasis on ensuring diversity in our team and inclusion in our culture.

We feel enormously privileged to be one of the few companies that has the opportunity to take a shot at truly revolutionizing education with AI at this inflection point in technology. We don’t take it for granted, so we work quite hard to turn that vision into reality with urgency. We want to create an environment in which we can all be our best selves, use our strengths to take Ello forward, and develop our own skills. We want to have fun while working hard to do impactful things that we’re proud of – and we believe it’s possible to do both.

Our mission at Ello is simple and urgent: Maximize the potential of every child, everywhere. To close that gap, we’re building the world’s first AI tutor: one that listens, speaks, adapts, and inspires, just like the best human teachers.

Our first product, Read with Ello, is already helping tens of thousands of kids each week learn to read. It listens as they read aloud, offers support when they stumble, and generates magical, personalized stories.

Now, we’re scaling that success into something even bigger: a complete AI teacher for all children. It’s a 1:1 tutor that combines language, speech, and memory to deliver interactive education for kids worldwide. We move fast and test directly with families to create products that kids love.


ABOUT THE ROLE

We’re looking for an ML Engineer to join our 5-person applied ML team. Our team operates at the intersection of research and production, solving open-ended problems while delivering real-world products. We use the best tool for the job, whether that’s a novel machine learning model or software engineering fundamentals.

You’re excited to build an AI product that pushes the boundaries of what’s possible in education. You believe that great products and research strengthen each other. You’ll thrive here if you enjoy building scalable systems from the ground up and bringing research to life in real-world products. You’ll make an edit in your Jupyter notebook this week, deploy it on-device next week, and watch it bring smiles to kids’ faces a day later.


WHAT YOU’LL DO

 - Own projects end-to-end from data through to production (e.g. conversational agents, learner adaptation, or speech perception)

 - Collaborate with learning experts and product engineers to translate research into an AI tutor that understands, adapts, and interacts with children everywhere

 - Build with the latest advancements in machine learning


ABOUT YOU

 - 3+ years of experience in AI/ML research or engineering, preferably with speech systems or LLMs

 - Proven track record across the modeling lifecycle: data acquisition, experimentation, evaluation, and productionization

 - Experience with Python, deep learning frameworks, and distributed computing

 - Proficiency in applied mathematics and linear algebra at the level where you can contribute to research discussions with a deeply technical team


BONUS POINTS

 - Public projects that demonstrate technical creativity

 - Track record of publications in top machine learning conferences (NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, etc.)

 - Depth in low-latency inference at scale

 - Strong product intuition


WE LOOK FOR CANDIDATES WHO

 - Have something to teach us

 - Have an urge to make a real impact on child development at scale

 - Take initiative and full ownership of their work

 - Prefer open and direct communication grounded in empathy to beating around the bush

 - Want to build meaningful relationships at work


WHO YOU’LL BE JOINING

Ello’s 5-person applied ML team includes some of the world’s foremost experts in their areas. For instance, our speech perception efforts are led by the co-authors of wav2vec https://arxiv.org/abs/2006.11477. At Ello, they’ve built the world’s best child speech recognition system, beating Whisper. That ability to deeply understand child speech enables us to design magical experiences for early childhood learning. We work on a broad range of machine learning problems across agent reliability, learner adaptation, and multimodal perception. We collaborate closely with advisors from Stanford and top industry research labs (on a weekly basis, not in some hands-off way). We work in-person out of our San Francisco office and we’re big believers in face-to-face collaboration.
